snippet.title: Pyongyang's pop queens stage comeback
snippet.description: Step aside, Sea of Blood Opera. North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's favorite guitar-slinging, miniskirt-sporting girl group, the Moranbong Band, is back. And these ladies know how to shimmy.

snippet.title: Looking for a race less challenging than a marathon?
snippet.description: Forget 26.2 or 13.1. Try .10 or .05 if you want to participate in a race without months (or even minutes) of training.

snippet.title: Cox relishes first Boston Marathon
snippet.description: W.T. Woodson senior Emily Cox, the youngest female runner in the field of 36,000, completed her first Boston Marathon with memories that will last a lifetime.

snippet.title: Apolo Ohno training to compete at Ironman
snippet.description: Apolo Ohno is used to riding a bike in training.

snippet.title: Metro to open early for marathon Sunday
snippet.description: Metro says it will open early Sunday for the Nike Women's Half Marathon, and there will be weekend adjustments for track work.

snippet.title: Was the police response to the Boston bombing really appropriate?
snippet.description: It's time we had a frank discussion about how the government reacted after the Boston Marathon bombing.

snippet.title: Are some moms more hard wired than others to exercise?
snippet.description: Some women come by exercising post-partum naturally. Others, like myself, have to work at it.

snippet.title: Runner can't make it to the Boston Marathon finish line, so others carry him to the end
snippet.description: Well, this is just a lovely example of people helping one another out.

snippet.title: The 2014 Boston Marathon: Live updates
snippet.description: On Monday, a little more than a year after the Boston Marathon bombing, the runners will return to Boylston Street.
